text:
I have a DataFrame column that has three unique elements `unique(df.Test_Description)`
```3-element Array{String,1}:
 "COVID-19 Antigen"
 "COVID-19 RT-PCR"
 "COVID-19 Molecular"```
and I would like to replace each instance with an easier identifer ... maybe like `Antigen, PCR, Molecular`

elements.text: I have a DataFrame column that has three unique elements
and I would like to replace each instance with an easier identifer ... maybe like

text:
I feel like my funtion here can be made more Julia
```function my_rep(test_desc) 
    rep = Array{String, 1}(undef, length(test_desc))
    for (i, x) in enumerate(test_desc)
        if x == "COVID-19 Antigen"
            rep[i] = "Antigen"
        elseif x == "COVID-19 RT-PCR"
            rep[i] = "PCR"
        elseif x == "COVID-19 Molecular"
            rep[i] = "Molecular"
        end
    end
    return rep
end

transform!(df, :Test_Description => my_rep => :Test_Description)```

elements.text: I feel like my funtion here can be made more Julia

function my_rep(test_desc) 
    rep = Array{String, 1}(undef, length(test_desc))
    for (i, x) in enumerate(test_desc)
        if x == "COVID-19 Antigen"
            rep[i] = "Antigen"
        elseif x == "COVID-19 RT-PCR"
            rep[i] = "PCR"
        elseif x == "COVID-19 Molecular"
            rep[i] = "Molecular"
        end
    end
    return rep
end

transform!(df, :Test_Description => my_rep => :Test_Description)

text:
How about
```rep = Dict(
  "COVID-19 Antigen" => "Antigen",
  "COVID-19 RT-PCR" => "PCR",
  "COVID-19 Molecular" => "Molecular",
)

transform!(df, :Test_Description => (x -> rep[x]) => :Test_Description)```

elements.text:
rep = Dict(
  "COVID-19 Antigen" => "Antigen",
  "COVID-19 RT-PCR" => "PCR",
  "COVID-19 Molecular" => "Molecular",
)

transform!(df, :Test_Description => (x -> rep[x]) => :Test_Description)
